title: Brexit is a 'contagious disease' that risks infecting the Bloc, says Brussels, so a deal is a tantalising prospect
text:
Brussels has regarded the state of British politics with growing horror and revulsion ever since the Brexit referendum. The EU sees Britain as polarised, aggressive and unreliable, with senior officials likening Brexit to a contagious disease that risks spreading to the Continent and infecting the inner workings of the bloc.

Little wonder that the European Commission is now straining to get a deal done rather than risk a general election that could land Brussels with an even more truculent and unpredictable negotiating partner.

It has long been Brussels orthodoxy to dismiss the Brexit referendum as a victory built on populist lies.
